page.head: Prenatal Care
page.body:
Dental disease in pregnant mothers is closely correlated with dental disease in their infants.
Bacteria and infection can easily spread from a mother to her child in the months after birth.
All primary caregivers should have full medical checkups including dental checkups to identify and treat disease before birth.

page.head: Prenatal Care
page.body:
To avoid passing bacteria to infants, caregivers should clean their mouths using xylitol based anti-bacterial wipes.
To promote healthy tooth development, pregnant mothers should insure that they get enough Vitamin D in their diet.
